case_name_full: The People of the State of New York v. Leobardo Romero-Morales

opinions.opinion_text:
Appeal by the defendant from a judgment of the Supreme Court, Westchester County (Rosato, J.), rendered February 27, 2003, convicting him of manslaughter in the first degree, upon his plea of guilty, and imposing sentence.
Ordered that the judgment is affirmed.
We have reviewed the record and agree with the defendant’s assigned counsel that there are no nonfrivolous issues which could be raised on appeal. Counsel’s application for leave to withdraw as counsel is granted (see Anders v California, 386 US 738 [1967]; People v Paige, 54 AD2d 631 [1976]; cf. People v Gonzalez, 47 NY2d 606 [1979]). Adams, J.P., Goldstein, Smith, Rivera and Lifson, JJ., concur.

court_short_name: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York
court_full_name: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of the State of New York
